Lyrics: Como Santa María fez a un cavaleiro que gãasse ũa igreja que lle prometera.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary caused a knight to win a church which he had promised to Her.

Lyrics: Como a demais da gente | quér gãar per falssidade,
Direct Translation: Just as othe rpeople try to win through falsehood,
Poetic Translation: Much as others try to win things through deceit and shameless lying,

Lyrics: assí quér Santa María | gãar per sa santidade.
Direct Translation: so does Holy Mray win through holiness.
Poetic Translation: Holy Mary always triumphs through Her Holiness undying.

Lyrics: Ca se Déus déu aas gentes | jógos pera alegría
Direct Translation: For if God gave people games so that they might have amusement,
Poetic Translation: For to people games were given by the Father to amuse them.

Lyrics: averen, todo o tórnan | elas en tafuraría,
Direct Translation: they turn everything into gambling
Poetic Translation: But we turn them into gambling; to make money, we misuse them.

Lyrics: e daquesta guisa quéren | gãar; mais Santa María
Direct Translation: and try to prosper in this way. However, such profit
Poetic Translation: But we know that Holy Mary frowns on wagers when She views them;

Lyrics: non lle praz de tal gaança, | mais da que é con verdade.
Direct Translation: does not please Holy Mary but only that won honestly.
Poetic Translation: She prefers we gain our profits honestly, by sin denying.

Lyrics: E porên contar-vos quéro | miragre que ei oído
Direct Translation: Therefore, I wish to tell you a miracle which I heard
Poetic Translation: So I'll tell you all the story of a miracle created

Lyrics: desta razôn, que a Virgen | fez, Madre do Rei comprido,
Direct Translation: on this theme, performed by the Virgin, Mother of the Perfect King
Poetic Translation: By the Virgin, Holy Mother of the Perfect King awaited,

Lyrics: que por nos guardar d' inférno | foi na cruz mórt' e ferido.
Direct Translation: who was wounded and killed on the cross to save us from Hell.
Poetic Translation: Who was wounded and who suffered on the Cross and sin negated.

Lyrics: E porên, se Déus vos valla, | amigos, ben m' ascoitade:
Direct Translation: Therefore, my friends, if God will aid you, listen to me well.
Poetic Translation: So, my friends, if God will aid you, listen now with hearts complying.

Lyrics: Dous ómes dados jogavan | a gran perfía provada,
Direct Translation: Two men were avidly playing dice.
Poetic Translation: Once two men at dice were playing, far too keen for simple pleasure.

Lyrics: e un deles éra ric', o | outro non avía nada
Direct Translation: One of them was rich, and the other had nothing
Poetic Translation: One was rich and lived in comfort; one had nothing he could treasure

Lyrics: senôn quant' ũa eigreja, | con que fazía passada,
Direct Translation: except for a church, with which he made his living,
Poetic Translation: But a church, whose income fed him to a full but humble measure,

Lyrics: que fora de séu linnage | e del ben come erdade.
Direct Translation: which had been in his family and had been bequeathed to him.
Poetic Translation: Which had always been his family's and was willed him on their dying.

Lyrics: E macar que d' outros jógos | éran eles sabedores,
Direct Translation: Although they knew other games,
Poetic Translation: Though the games they knew were many, to one game they were devoted.

Lyrics: entôn outro non jogavan, | senôn aquel que ‘maiores’
Direct Translation: they never played anything but that game called mayores*.
Poetic Translation: They played nothing but mayores: three dice rolled, the total's noted.
Notes: *Mayores: A game played with three dice in which the highest total wins.

Lyrics: chaman; e o riqu' en lógo | de meter i fïadores,
Direct Translation: The rich man, instead of putting up counters,
Poetic Translation: But instead of common counters, on this day the rich man loaded

Lyrics: meteu i muitos dinneiros | por comprir sa voontade.
Direct Translation: threw in many coins to make his bets.
Poetic Translation: Up the pot with coins of value, earnest wagers thus implying.

Lyrics: Mas o outro non avía | outra requeza sobeja
Direct Translation: However, the other man had no wealth
Poetic Translation: But the poor man had no money equalling his opposition;

Lyrics: que ao jógo metesse, | mas meteu i a eigreja
Direct Translation: to place on the game, so he put up the church
Poetic Translation: He put up the church he lived on, thoughtless toward his own position,

Lyrics: de que vos ja dit' avemos, | dizendo: "Se quér que seja
Direct Translation: about which we have already told you, saying: "If it be
Poetic Translation: Saying, "If the Father wills it that you win this competition,

Lyrics: Déus que o jógo gãedes, | esta igreja levade."
Direct Translation: God's will that you win the game, take this church."
Poetic Translation: Take this church I own and have it and the profit it's supplying."

Lyrics: O rico, quand' oiu esto, | volveu na mão os dados
Direct Translation: The rich man, when he heard this, shook the dice in his hands
Poetic Translation: When the rich man heard, then rolling went the dice; their clatter sounded.

Lyrics: e lançou senas al terce, | que son de pontos contados
Direct Translation: and threw thee sixes, which totals eighteen points,
Poetic Translation: And by luck he threw three sixes, which when tallied up amounted

Lyrics: déz e oito; e mas pontos | non póden seer achados.
Direct Translation: the most points possible.
Poetic Translation: To eighteen, the highest number that in this game could be counted.

Lyrics: O outro, quando viu esto, | diss': "Ai, Virgen de bondade
Direct Translation: The other, when he saw this, said: "Oh, benevolent Virgin
Poetic Translation: When the poor man saw, he called on Holy Mary, loudly crying.

Lyrics: De Rocamador, Sennora | de todos bẽes comprida,
Direct Translation: "of Rocamadour, My Lady full of grace,
Poetic Translation: Virgin Queen of Rocamadour, Lady full of grace and favor

Lyrics: vóssa mercee non seja | agora en mi falida;
Direct Translation: by your mercy, do not permit me to lose.
Poetic Translation: With Your sympathy and mercy, do not let me lose this wager.

Lyrics: mais dou-vos esta igreja | por vóssa, en que servida
Direct Translation: I shall give you this church as yours, in which you may be woshipped.
Poetic Translation: I will give this church as Your church, wherein we will praise Your nature.

Lyrics: sejades. Venced' o jógo | e a eigreja fillade."
Direct Translation: Win the game and take the church."
Poetic Translation: Win the game and take the church now, for on You I am relying."

Lyrics: E des i, pois diss' aquesto, | lógo os dados filló-os
Direct Translation: After he said this, he at once picked up the dice
Poetic Translation: After saying this, he gathered up the dice and went to throw them,

Lyrics: na mão e mui coitado | eno tavleiro lançó-os.
Direct Translation: in his hands and anxiously threw them on the gaming board,
Poetic Translation: Anxiously, with shaking handhold, on the gaming board below them.

Lyrics: Mas a Virgen, que de Reïs | ven de todo-los avóos,
Direct Translation: but the Virgin, all of whose ancestors are kings,
Poetic Translation: But the Virgin, who's the daughter of all Kings, began to show them

Lyrics: fez que un daqueles dados | se fendeu per meiadade.
Direct Translation: made one of those dice break in half.
Poetic Translation: Her own strength, for die one fractured, broke in half when it went flying.

Lyrics: E como do as a face | devía jazer de juso,
Direct Translation: Whereas the ace should face downward,
Poetic Translation: Normally, the ace would lie there, downward facing, as he threw it,

Lyrics: fez per si dad' a sa parte, | e tornou-s' o as de suso
Direct Translation: She made it split off and turn face upward,
Poetic Translation: But She split it from the cube and turned it up so all could view it.

Lyrics: e de seis o outro meo | pareceu non a escuso,
Direct Translation: and the other half and the other two dice
Poetic Translation: And the other broken half’s side plus both other dice would do it:

Lyrics: e os outros dous de senas, | pois déz e nóv' i contade.
Direct Translation: showed six -- so count nineteen.
Poetic Translation: All were six, plus one: the total was nineteen, the winnings buying.

Lyrics: Assí gannou a eigreja | Santa María por súa,
Direct Translation: And so Holy Mary won the church for Her own,
Poetic Translation: And so Holy Mary won it, showed Her strength where people crowded.

Lyrics: que o viron entôn todos | quantos estavan na rúa;
Direct Translation: and all who were standing in the street saw it.
Poetic Translation: All who in that street were standing saw a miracle undoubted.

Lyrics: e o que venceu o jógo | disse: "Sennor, seja túa,
Direct Translation: The man who won the game said: "My Lady, let it be yours,
Poetic Translation: And the man who won the game said, "Lady mine, since You allowed it

Lyrics: ca per ti a ei cobrada | e por ta gran pïadade."
Direct Translation: for through you and your great mercy I recovered it."
Poetic Translation: To return to me, now have it as Your own, all vice defying."

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
